subject: Public Speaking
title: Humor in the Middle
description: A micro-lesson that makes Humor in the Middle usable.

hook.text: Humor breaks tension. It makes audiences trust you.

buildup.text: Bad humor crashes harder than any other speech element.

discovery.text: Good humor illustrates your points, not distracts from them.

twist.text: Self-deprecating humor builds connection better than attack humor.

climax.text: Timing matters more than the joke. Pause before punchlines.

punchline.text: Make them laugh. Then make them think.
